Modular prompt scripting. Finally.

And right in your markdown files, no less.

@import [roles, tasks] from [prompts.mld] @text arch = @embed [README.md # Architecture] @text standards = @embed [README.md # Code Standards] @text diff = @run [git diff | cat] @text prompt = [[ Read our docs: {{arch}} {{standards}} Latest changes: {{diff}} Your task: {{tasks.codereview}} ]] @run [oneshot {{prompt}} --system {{roles.architect}}] ---
# TypeBlorp ## Overview TypeBlorp is lightweight state management library built with TypeScript, with a unidirectional data flow pattern combined with observer-based pub/sub architecture. Here's the structure of the codebase: @run [tree --gitignore] @embed {{docs.architecture}} as ## Architecture @embed {{docs.standards}} as ## Code Standards

npm install -g meld oneshot

what is prompt scripting?

If you've experienced the pain,
you know what you want it to be.

Tired of repeating yourself

"Working with LLMs is like having a brilliant intern with chronic amnesia. I'd do a lot more if re-assembling context wasn't such a chore."

Tired of wrong tools for the job

"I just want to script LLMs. A chat or an IDE isn't helpful for that. Don't give me a kitchen sink 'agentic framework' or a magic black box. Give me a unix pipe."

And if you've experienced the possibility,
you know what you want it to be.

Embed LLM context in your docs


  # Overview

  Here's the structure of the codebase:
  
  @run [tree --gitignore]

Chain requests like shell commands


@text tests = @run [npm test]

@text res = @run [oneshot "What's broken here? {{tests}}"]

@run [oneshot "Make a plan to fix {{res}}"]

---

"Here's a plan to fix the failing tests."

Use imports and module sections


  @import [roles] from [roles.mld]


  @text infra = @embed [TESTING.md # Infrastructure]
  
  @text prompt = [[
    Read our docs: {{infra}} {{standards}}
    Review this set of changes: {{diff}}
    Please create a list of the tests we
    should add to cover the changes.
  ]]
  
  @run [oneshot {{prompt}} --system {{roles.architect}}]

  ---

  "Here's a list of the tests to add…"
